column4: How do I boot a recovery partition to reinstall windows when grub stops the recovery partition from erasing my drive to put windows back? I want to do this so I can then install ubuntu  side-by-side with windows so I can have a vbox emulator running on ubuntu, allowing me to have a liunx+windows environment. BTW this is being done on a Acer Aspire One Netbook(I have a cd/dvd rom drive for it)
use your windows install disc to reinstall ntldr, the windows bootloader, to replace grub
the recovery partition is my windows disk
*blink* they didnt give you a cd/dvd?
no
bad
how would I make the patch work?
fix it. figure out why the context lines around those hunks dont match, and fix them
ok... I'm a bit new, how would I undo the patch, if possible?
patch -R to reverse the patch
its best to always use --dry-run when applying a patch, to see if any hunks will fail
oh...

you're going to need to be able to read a bit of code without running screaming to fix the patch. enough to go through and notice "hey, this hunk goes *here* and the patch thinks it has this line above it, but that line has since changed in thsi way, so if i tweak the patch to match that, it'll apply"
note i didnt say *understand* code...just read through without running away ;-)
ok got it :)
um if you just run make, does that change the main source files?
it shouldnt modify in-place, no. it should build more files though
so... ok, I can stop make, and retry the patch then config again, then use make again without having to start all over and re-download the source?
right
you may want to know about "make clean" though ;-)
ok... I'm assuming that "make clean" clears any files "make" made?
yep
